intro: [WRONG START] Premna mariannum f. dentata, commonly known as the toothed premna, is a shrub native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins that give it its distinguishing name. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by spherical, fleshy fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas. Its foliage is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
